summary: Foreign governments acquire billions of dollars of military goods and services every year through the foreign military sales program administered by the Department of Defense. We found that several factors contributed to delays or higher prices in this program—such as federal budget uncertainty and equipment defects identified during testing. title: Foreign Military Sales: Expanding Use of Tools to Sufficiently Define Requirements Could Enable More Timely Acquisitions
